InfoSport YOUR ASSISTANT YOUR GENDER Determine the body type Application Information The information provided in this application is for reference and is provided as recommendations. The author is not responsible for the consequences of improper exercise performance. Version 1.0.0 Write to the developers Rate the app Contact the developer Usually wiry and thin. They can eat everything in a row and not get better at the same time. Training program The figure has the shape of a king bell. Metabolism is aimed at storing fat. Training program Strong build with broad shoulders and chest and strong legs. Training program
(legs) (chest,triceps) (back,biceps,\n press) Day 1 Day 2 Day 3
Is it possible to take expired sports nutrition? Is it possible to take expired protein? If the protein was stored in a dry, dark, cool place and moisture did not get into the container, then such a protein can be taken for 12–18 months after the expiration date.
Carbohydrate window After physical exercises, the body can absorb nutrients with great speed. He assimilates them 4 times faster than before. The reason for this is the banal consumption of energy resources.
The most popular fitness destinations 1. CrossFit\n2. Yoga\n3. Zumba-dance for weight loss\n4. Insanity-high-intensity aerobics\n5. P90x-real strength training program for home
Equipment What should I take for training?\n1. Power belt\n2. Elastic bandage\n3. Gloves
What is Cheating? Cheating – indicates a violation of the technique of performing the exercise.\n The five best exercises for reading:\n 1. Bending the legs lying down \n 2. Lifting on socks \n 3. Lifting the arms to the sides \n 4. Belt pull while sitting on the block (upper pull)\n 5. Alternate lifting of dumbbells Training in the heat: how to maintain productivity and not harm your health Alas, not all gyms have climate control systems that they are able to maintain optimal temperature and humidity indicators for training. Tips for training in the heat: 1. Drink more fluids. Training in the heat leads to a significant increase in sweating and, as a result, to the loss of a large amount of fluid. 2. Reduce the intensity of training. The more intense the workout, the more the pulse increases and the more it affects the cardiovascular system 3. Drink sugary drinks. Since the active operation of thermoregulation mechanisms requires a large amount of energy, many people feel tired in the heat.
DAY 1 (LEGS) DAY 2 (CHEST,TRICEPS) DAY 3 (BACK,BICEPS,ABS) (chest,triceps,\n abs) Your body type: Ectomorph Your body type: Mesomorph Your body type: Endomorph Enter the wrist circumference Result The percentage of fat in your body is: Close Excellent form Time to lose weight All fields must be filled in Your maximum heart rate during exercise should not exceed: Great, keep up the good work! It is necessary to fill in the field \'Age (years)\' Result of kcal per day: You need to: kcal All fields must be filled in Daily water allowance You need to drink: liters of water per day You need to drink: liters of water per day All fields must be filled in The result of the weight assessment: Your ideal weight: kg
It is necessary to fill in the field \'Enter height in centimeters\' This block contains training plans Tap the icon to continue In this block you will be able to choose different dishes for the meal plan How about without a stopwatch during rest and not only There is nowhere to write down information about training, leave notes in the notes! You need information about training, the \'Articles\' section will help you In this section you will be able to calculate, starting from the ideal weight and ending with the % body fat content You are given the opportunity to choose a male gender... Tap the button to continue And so the female gender by clicking on the \'SELECT\' button Tap again to exit the app Are you sure you want to delete? My name is Kronos and I am your navigation assistant for the app. I\'ll tell you about the main features of the application and show them. CONTINUE ARTICLES BODY TYPE CALCULATORS ectomorph DAY 1 (CHEST,TRICEPS,ABS) BACK 2 (BACK,BICEPS) DAY 3 (SHOULDERS,LEGS,ABS) endomorph mesomorph DAY 2 (CHEST,DAY) DAY 3 (LEGS) DAY 1 (BACK, SHOULDERS) NUTRITION TIMER Add a note Exercises
Hyperextension
Barbell squats
The pull of the block to the chest
Lunges with dumbbells
Dumbbell pull to the belt in a tilt
Deadlift with barbell
Push-ups on the bench
(3 sets of 15-20 repetitions)
(2 sets of 10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 9 repetitions)
(2 sets of 8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 12 repetitions)
Insert your legs into the hyperextension simulator, remove your hands behind your head. Keeping your back straight, lower the body and then lift it up. At the top point, look at the wall in front of you. Avoid jerks and sudden movements, perform the exercise smoothly and under control.
Put your feet a little wider than the straightened shoulders, bring the shoulder blades together, turn the socks of the feet a little to the sides. Pull the pelvis back, bend slightly in the lower back and with an inspiration go into a squat. Keep your back straight, look forward. Sit down to the parallel of the hips with the floor. If the heels do not come off it, the knees do not wrap inwards, and the back remains straight, try to sit down lower. If at the same time the back is rounded, return to the previous position, that is, again make the hips parallel to the floor. Get out of the squat on the exhale.
Sit on the bench, press your feet to the floor. Grasp the handle with a straight (emphasis on the back) or reverse (emphasis on the biceps) grip. You can change them every week. Bring your shoulder blades together, lower your shoulders, straighten your back. As you exhale, pull the handle up to touch the chest. The body does not bend back, the shoulders are lowered, the shoulder blades are brought together.
Hold the dumbbells at arm\'s length. Lunge forward, touch the floor with the knee of the leg standing behind. Make sure that the front knee does not go beyond the sock.
Stand up and lunge with the other leg. You can do these exercises in motion or, if the gym is crowded, on the spot.
Put your left arm and knee on a support, for example, on a bench or a box. Straighten your back, lower your shoulders and arm with a dumbbell, bring your shoulder blades together.
Pull the dumbbell up to your waist and lower it again. It is very important to pull it to the belt, not to the chest, not to raise your shoulders and not to spread your shoulder blades. Otherwise, you will shift the focus from your hands to your back muscles.
Stand close to the barbell so that the neck is above the lacing of the sneakers. Sit down, pulling the pelvis back. Grasp the barbell with a straight grip slightly wider than the shoulders. Keep your back straight throughout the exercise. Lift the barbell, fully straighten in the hip joint, then return to the starting position.
Find a support: a box, a bench, a stack of steps. Turn your back to her, put your hands on her, straighten your knees. Do a reverse push-up to parallel the shoulders with the floor, but not below. Return to the starting position.
Barbell squats
Leg press in the simulator
Leg extension while sitting
Deadlift
(4 sets of 8 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8 repetitions)
1. Go to the barbell rack. Take it in such a way that the neck is on the upper part of the sternum and the front parts of the deltas \n2. At the same time, you can cross your arms or put them on the neck with a grip from above \n3. Take a couple of steps away from the counter, put your feet shoulder-width apart \n4. Take a breath and start going down. Continue the movement until the hips are parallel to the floor \n5. Having fixed for a second at the bottom point, return to the starting position. Exhale and repeat the exercise the required number of times
1. Taking a comfortable fixed position in the simulator, put your feet on the platform \n2. After that, remove the weight clamps with the levers (usually they are located on the sides of the seat) \n3. With the next movement, lower the weight of the platform by bending your legs at the knees \n4. After that, from the lowest point of the amplitude, exhaling, push the platform up with your feet (do not fully straighten your knees)
1. The back should be pressed against the seat. \n2. It is impossible to shift and rise from the place during the exercise. \n3. For secure fixation and performing concentrated extension, grasp the handles or seat of the simulator. \n4. Bending your knees, place your ankles under the roller. \n5. Straighten your legs with an exhalation, then fix the position for a second. \n6. As you inhale, slowly lower your legs to the starting position.
1. Feet should stand shoulder-width apart \n2. Sit down and grab the barbell using a straight grip (when the palms are pointing in your direction) \n3. The grip should be such that the hands are slightly apart from each other, the width of the shoulders \n4. Take a barbell and straighten up with it \n5. Then, slowly lower the body body forward so that the barbell is below knee level \n6. Then get up and return to the starting position
Tilt barbell press. bench
Dumbbell press on the slope. bench
Dumbbell wiring
Push-ups on the uneven bars
French bench press
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
1. Take a position on an inclined bench, adjusting the seat so that the neck is at eye level. \n2. When performing a bench press, the neck should move at the level of the upper line of the pectoral muscles (or above the upper part of the pectoral muscles). The grip in this exercise is identical to the classic grip when pressing on a horizontal bench. A wide grip, in which the hands are as close as possible to the weighting discs, can also be used, but do not forget that such an arrangement of hands on the neck is more traumatic. \n3. The correct grip implies the vertical position of the elbows at the lowest point of the amplitude. The back should be pressed against the back of the bench. \n4. The inhale is done at the moment when the barbell is above the head at the highest point of the amplitude, and is accompanied by lowering the barbell to the chest, and the exhale is done at the time of the press. \n5. Hands at the peak of the amplitude should not be straightened to the end, since when the arms are extended, the triceps are fully connected to the work. In the lower part of the amplitude, the neck should not touch the chest. \n6. An important point is the stretching of the chest with air. Due to this, the chest muscles stretch when inhaling, which gives a better muscle contraction.
1. The bench is installed at an angle of 45 degrees \n2. Inhale and exhale, and on exhaling, without a jerk, raise your arm at the elbow \n3. It is not necessary to bend the arm until the dumbbell touches the arm – just as it is not necessary to achieve a straight arm at the end of the movement when extending \n4. Elbows remain motionless during execution – do not bring them back or to the sides
1. To perform the exercise, you need to sit on a bench and put dumbbells on your knees, then take a lying position. With your knees, you need to push the dumbbells to your chest. \n2. The arms should be stretched up in front of the chest, and the dumbbells should touch each other. It is important to keep a small angle at the elbows. \n3. The movement begins with the dilution of dumbbells to the sides on inspiration. It is very important that the elbows look down. The end point of the amplitude is approximately parallel to the floor. \n4. At the lower point of the amplitude, a short pause should be made. \n5. After a pause at the bottom point, return the dumbbells to their original position on exhalation. \n6. The movement is performed only by means of contraction of the pectoral muscles. Perform the exercise in a concentrated manner.
1. We take the starting position: the body is between the bars, the palms embrace them and look at each other, the back is straight, the gaze is directed forward \n2. On the inhale, we begin to move, bending our arms at the elbows \n3. The lowest point of movement is when the shoulders are almost at the same level with the bars \n4. At the bottom point, you should fix yourself for a couple of seconds, then, on exhalation, with the tension of the muscles of the press, make an ascent by unbending your arms
1. Place the neck on special racks for French bench press, or hold the neck on your chest, place your palms on the neck along the width of the shoulder joints, and slowly lie down on your back. At the bottom point, lift the barbell up, fully straightening your elbows. \n2. Press the lower back to the bench, if it is impossible, put your feet on the bench, thus removing the deflection of the lumbar region. \n3. Hold the barbell over your shoulders, do not pull your elbows to the sides. \n4. As you inhale, lower the barbell to your forehead, but without touching it. Movement occurs only in the elbow joint. \n5. With an exhalation, straighten your elbows to the end, without taking them away when lifting through the sides.
Pull-ups with a wide grip
Rod pull in tilt
Thrust of the upper block
Army bench press
Lifting the barbell on the biceps while standing
Hammer bends
Lifting dumbbells while sitting
(4 approaches to failure)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
1. Approach the projectile of a suitable height \n2. Place the palms at the required width from each other \n3. Grab hold of the projectile, slightly bending your legs under you, to level the use of leg muscles when pulling up \n4. Slowly pull up, keeping the deflection in the back \n5. Then stay at the top point for 1-2 seconds \n6. After that, start the descent from the projectile as slowly as possible \n7. The lower point should not be in full extension of the elbows \n8. Climb to the crossbar again
1. The athlete must stand in front of the barbell, put his feet shoulder-width apart. \n2. The knees should be slightly bent. \n3. It is necessary to take the barbell with your palms shoulder-width apart, without bending your arms at the elbows, then straighten up. The starting position is as follows: the loin is slightly bent, the torso is tilted forward. The angle of inclination is approximately 30 degrees. \n4. The legs are bent at the knees. The muscles of the lower back should be in tension. \n5. The starting point of the amplitude of the barbell is at the athlete\'s knees, the end point of the amplitude is at the belt. \n6. In the initial movement, an inhalation is made, and when the barbell is pulled to the belt, an exhalation is made, after which, on the reverse return movement to the starting position, an inhalation is again made.
1. Grasp the fingerboard crossbar with both hands. Turn the inside of the hands (palms) forward \n2. Make a deflection in the lower back, tilt the head 15-20 cm back \n3. By the strength of the back muscles (wings) pull the weight up or down the chest
1. Stand in front of the barbell, put your feet on the width of the pelvis, grab the barbell with a grip slightly wider than the shoulders. \n2. Rise with a straight back, bend your elbows and lift the barbell to the upper chest (on the collarbone). \n3. Lower your elbows to the floor, do not lean your body back, hold your spine with the strength of the stabilizer muscles. \n4. Exhale and lift the barbell over your head, fully extending your elbows. \n5. As you inhale, gently lower the neck to the clavicle part of the chest without dropping the barbell.
1. Take a position in front of the mirror, taking the barbell in your hands. \n2. The legs should stand shoulder-width apart. \n3. The arms with the neck are lowered to the bottom. \n4. The grip can be narrow, straight or wide. The location of the brushes on the neck creates an emphasis on a part of the target muscles: the wider the grip, the more the long head of the biceps works, and the narrower it is, the more the short head is worked out. \n5. Please note that the back should be straight throughout the exercise. \n6. The upward movement, lifting the barbell, is performed on exhalation. \n7. The peak of the amplitude will come at the moment when the arms are completely bent at the joints. \n8. With exhalation, the barbell descends to the hips. \n9. In any case, do not tilt the body to the sides.
1.The athlete must place his feet at shoulder level. The back should be strictly in an upright position. Hands with dumbbells held by a neutral grip are placed on the sides along the hips. Elbow joints are straight. \n2. The movement begins on exhalation. The athlete bends his arms at the elbow joint, straining the shoulder muscles (biceps). Please note that the elbow joints should not move from their place throughout the exercise. \n3. The reverse movement should be performed on the inhale slightly slower than the upward movement.
1. Starting position: adjust the angle of inclination of the bench in the position from 80 to 90 degrees \n2. On exhalation: strain the abdominal muscles and lower back, squeeze the dumbbells up in an arc \n3. On the inhale: after lingering at the top point for a second, we return the dumbbells to the starting position with a slow and controlled movement
Bench press
Bench press on the slope. bench
Breeding dumbbells lying down
Push-ups on the uneven bars
Bench press with a narrow grip
French bench press
Triceps on the block
Lifting the body on the bench
(3 sets of 6-8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6-8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6-8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 10-12 repetitions)
(4-5 approaches to failure)
1. Gently, as you inhale, lower the barbell until it touches the lower part of the chest.\n2. As you exhale, squeeze the barbell up. During the exercise, make sure that the barbell moves only in the vertical plane. The elbows are under the neck at the same time. Throughout the movement, the shoulder blades remain contracted, and the lower back is bent. On the inhale - slowly down, on the exhale - powerfully up.
1. Take a position on an inclined bench, adjusting the seat so that the neck is at eye level.\n2. When performing a bench press, the neck should move at the level of the upper line of the pectoral muscles (or above the upper part of the pectoral muscles). The grip in this exercise is identical to the classic grip when pressing on a horizontal bench. The correct grip implies the vertical position of the elbows at the lowest point of the amplitude.\n3.The back should be pressed against the back of the bench.
1. Sit on a bench and firmly rest your feet on the floor. With the effort of the body, throw the dumbbells on the hips \n2. Slowly lie down on the bench and at the same time straighten your arms with dumbbells up as you exhale \n3. Slightly bend your arms at the elbows, they should not be fully straightened \n4. Start slowly, feeling the careful stretching of the pectoral muscles, lower your arms to the level when the forearms become parallel to the floor \n5. Exhaling, with a sharp contraction of the pectoral muscles, return the dumbbells to the starting position \n6. Fix the peak contraction for 1 second, then repeat the movement until the end of the exercise
1. Take the starting position with straight arms at the top point. The body should be positioned strictly vertically, and the elbows should be turned back \n2. As you inhale, lower yourself down as much as possible until your shoulders are level with your elbows. Hands should be close to the body, do not go back or to the sides. Take a break \n3. As you exhale, press down with a powerful contraction of the arm muscles until the elbow joints are fully straightened. Pause
1. The neck is at eye level, the buttocks and shoulder blades touch the bench, the deflection is performed if it is convenient, and so the body is better stabilized on the bench. The \"bridge\" is not an end in itself in this bench press, as in other bench press movements; \n2. The feet can stand on their toes, or press against the floor, this moment depends on the height of the bench and the length of the athlete\'s legs. The main thing is a stable position of the legs so that they do not move along the \"perimeter\"; \n3. The neck is taken with a closed grip, usually slightly narrower than the shoulders, but this is individual. The triceps also works with an average grip, if you do not \"twist\" your elbows to the sides and do not bend your wrists
1.Lie down on the bench with the angle you have chosen. Take the barbell in your hands (by yourself, or let your partner give it), grip shoulder width apart. The shoulder blades are pressed against the surface on which you are lying, the legs are on the floor. The head is pressed down, lying closer to the edge of the bench. \n2. Lift the barbell up. This is a very important point. If you perform the option to the nose, then keep your hands perpendicular to the floor. \n3. We inhale and bend our arms at the elbow joint, thereby lowering the barbell to the point we have chosen, nose or behind the head. \n4. After fully lowering the barbell, immediately on exhalation, we unbend our arms and return them to their original position. Don\'t make any sudden movements.
1. Stand facing the Crossover, take the straight handle of the upper block with a grip from above along the edges. \n2. Place your feet on the width of the pelvis and press your elbows to the body. The forearms are relaxed, the handle is at shoulder level. \n3. Exhale: perform the extension of the arms without lifting the elbows, lowering the handle completely on the hips. \n4. Inhale: bend your elbows smoothly and without a jerk.
1. Place your legs under special rollers to fix the knee and ankle joints. The hips and buttocks should be in full contact with the inclined bench. \n2. Put your hands behind your head or hold them on your chest – this will simplify the load. \n3. Round your back at the top of the movement and do not unbend your spine until the end of the approach. \n4. As you inhale, pull the trunk back, keeping tension in the abdominal muscles, and lower it to such an extent that the angle between the trunk and the hips is about 90 degrees. Do not lower your back on the bench, remember about the tension in the abdominal muscles and the rounding of the spine. \n5. With an exhalation, twist the press, bringing the stomach to the hips, but do not straighten your back.
The pull of the upper block to the chest
Rod pull in tilt
Dumbbell pull in tilt
Deadlift
Biceps barbell lifts
Lifting dumbbells with supine.
Lifting the barbell with a grip from above
(3 sets of 8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6-8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
1. Sit on the bench of the simulator as close as possible, until the waist stops in the lower limiter \n2. We take the handle with a reverse grip (that is, the palms are turned in the direction of the trunk and lie down from the bottom of the handle) at shoulder level, or a little narrower \n3. On exhalation, pull the block until it touches the upper part of the pectoral muscles \n4. Linger briefly in this position, for maximum reduction of the widest \n5. While inhaling, while maintaining tension in the working muscles, return to the starting position
1. Stand in the starting position with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees bent \n2. Lift the barbell from the floor with a straight grip, arms slightly wider than the shoulders \n3. Move your elbows to the sides, tilt the body to an angle of 30 degrees with the surface \n4. Soften the knees \n5. On exhalation, pull the barbell until it touches the front surface of the chest \n6. Slowly lower to the initial level
1. The body is tilted at an angle of 90, the arm is lowered from the dumbbells, the neck is parallel to the body \n2. The supporting leg should be slightly pulled back to maintain balance \n3. The pelvis and shoulder girdle should be located parallel to the floor \n4. Lifting a dumbbell is necessary by the effort of the back muscles \n5. Twisting in the spine should not be allowed \n6. The same weight is usually used on both halves of the back
1. Put the barbell on the floor, having previously hung the pancakes of the desired weight. \n2. Stand in front of the barbell in the center, place your feet along the width of the pelvis, spread your socks apart quite a bit. \n3. Sit down, pulling the pelvis back, grab the barbell bar with your hands shoulder-width apart so that your knees are between your hands. \n4. Do not get up from the same position. To begin with, straighten the spine line, slightly bending the lower back inward, exposing the chest forward. \n5. The shoulder line should extend beyond the bar forward. \n6. Bring your shoulder blades together, keep your head neutral, do not rotate your head and do not throw it back. \n7. Before starting the movement, take a breath. Mainly due to the strength of the pelvis, begin to unbend the trunk and climb up until the spine and knees are fully straightened. \n8. Exhale at the top. \n9. Slowly return the barbell to the floor, stretching the neck along the shin, do not pull the pelvis back too far so that the load does not shift from the back.
1. Standing, legs shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent (remove the load from the knees). \n2. Grasp the neck from below, slightly wider than the shoulders. \n3. Exhale: bend your arms, lifting the barbell due to biceps efforts. \n4. Inhale: gently lower the barbell down.
1. Standing, legs shoulder-width apart, arms with dumbbells hanging freely at the sides. \n2. Exhale: lift the dumbbells, bending your elbows, keeping them pressed against the trunk. When the angle at the elbows reaches 90 degrees, begin to unfold the brushes with the inner side to the shoulders. Make an effort at the expense of the biceps, do not rock the body and do not lift the dumbbells with a jerk. \n3. Inhale: perform a slower lowering of the arms in reverse order, turning the hands to the starting position.
1. Place your hands on the neck (middle position). \n2. The back is straight, the shoulders are straightened, the legs are shoulder width apart. \n3. From the position of straight, lowered arms, bending is performed. \n4. The upward movement occurs on exhalation. The hands are pressed against the body and motionless. Only the forearms move. \n5. Movements are performed in a concentrated manner, without jerks. \n6. At the upper point of the amplitude (it is achievable with full flexion of the arms in the elbow joints), you need to pause for a second, after which you return the barbell to its original position as slowly as possible. Please note that it is not necessary to fully straighten the arms in the elbow joints, as this is traumatic. \n7. At the lower point of the movement, a breath is inhaled and a repeat is performed.
Standing chest barbell press
Dumbbell bench press
Swing dumbbells to the sides
Scars with a barbell
Barbell squats
Platform leg press
Leg lifts lying down
(3 sets of 8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 12-15 repetitions)
(3 sets of 6-8 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8 repetitions)
(4 approaches to failure)
1. Stand in front of the barbell, put your feet on the width of the pelvis, grab the barbell with a grip slightly wider than the shoulders. \n2. Rise with a straight back, bend your elbows and lift the barbell to the upper chest (on the collarbone). \n3. Lower your elbows to the floor, do not lean your body back, hold your spine with the strength of the stabilizer muscles. \n4. Exhale and lift the barbell over your head, fully extending your elbows. \n5. As you inhale, gently lower the neck to the clavicle part of the chest without dropping the barbell.
1. Starting position: adjust the angle of inclination of the bench in the position from 80 to 90 degrees \n2. On exhalation: strain the abdominal muscles and lower back, squeeze the dumbbells up in an arc \n3. On the inhale: after lingering at the top point for a second, we return the dumbbells to the starting position with a slow and controlled movement
1. bend your legs slightly, while the feet are parallel to each other, make a forward tilt so that the lower back bends slightly, and look in front of you \n2. Lower your shoulders, and hold the dumbbells in slightly bent arms, pancakes to each other, avoiding their contact \n3. With the body fixed, while inhaling, we spread our arms to the sides and linger for a second \n4. As you exhale, gently and calmly lower your hands and continue moving without stopping \n5. The elbows are turned up during the exercise, they look at the ceiling, we do not reduce the shoulder blades, otherwise the trapezius muscles will immediately turn into work \n6. The body is motionless during the exercise and does not sway
1. When performing the technique with a barbell in front, place the neck on the racks at a level just below the pelvis. \n2. Grasp the neck with a grip from above, slightly wider than the shoulders. Remove the barbell, move a little away from the racks and place your feet shoulder-width apart. \n3. With an exhalation, lift your shoulders, doing \'shrugs \', at the peak feel the maximum reduction of the trapezoid. Linger for a second at the peak of contraction. Perform the full range of motion. \n4. As you inhale, lower your shoulders, slowly stretching the trapezoids.
1. Go to the barbell rack. Take it in such a way that the neck is on the upper part of the sternum and the front parts of the deltas \n2. At the same time, you can cross your arms or put them on the neck with a grip from above \n3. Take a couple of steps away from the counter, put your feet shoulder-width apart \n4. Take a breath and start going down. Continue the movement until the hips are parallel to the floor \n5. Having fixed for a second at the bottom point, return to the starting position. Exhale and repeat the exercise the required number of times
1. Taking a comfortable fixed position in the simulator, put your feet on the platform. This will be the starting position. \n2. After that, remove the weight clamps using the levers (usually they are located on the sides of the seat). \n3. With the next movement, lower the weight of the platform by bending the legs at the knees. When performing this movement, you should inhale. At the lower point of the movement, the legs should form a right angle. It is very important not to take your feet off the platform, and your lower back off the back of the simulator. \n4. After that, from the lowest point of the amplitude, exhaling, push the platform up with your feet (do not fully straighten your knees).
1. On exhalation, lift straight legs up to the angle in which there is a distinct tension of the muscles of the press \n2. Stay in the top position for 3-5 seconds \n3. Slowly lower your legs to the floor, accompanying the movement with an inspiration. Stop when the distance from the floor to the heels of your feet is 15-20 cm
Pull-ups on the crossbar
Rod pull in tilt
Thrust of the upper block
Army bench press
The pull of the barbell to the chin
Dumbbell lifts
(4 approaches to failure)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
1. Grasp the crossbar with your hands, placing them shoulder-width apart. The grip should be palms down \n2. Then hang with straight arms, bending your knees \n3. Start pushing yourself up, bending your arms at the elbows. The chin should cross the upper line \n4. Then go down with straight arms. Take a breath and repeat the exercise
1. Stand in the starting position with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees bent \n2. Lift the barbell from the floor with a straight grip, arms slightly wider than the shoulders \n3. Move your elbows to the sides, tilt the body to an angle of 30 degrees with the surface \n4. Soften the knees \n5. On exhalation, pull the barbell until it touches the front surface of the chest \n6. Slowly lower to the initial level
1. Sit on the bench of the simulator as close as possible, until the waist stops in the lower limiter \n2. We take the handle with a reverse grip (that is, the palms are turned in the direction of the trunk and lie down from the bottom of the handle) at shoulder level, or a little narrower \n3. On exhalation, pull the block until it touches the upper part of the pectoral muscles \n4. Linger briefly in this position, for maximum reduction of the widest \n5. While inhaling, while maintaining tension in the working muscles, return to the starting position
1. Stand in front of the barbell, put your feet on the width of the pelvis, grab the barbell with a grip slightly wider than the shoulders. \n2. Rise with a straight back, bend your elbows and lift the barbell to the upper chest (on the collarbone). \n3. Lower your elbows to the floor, do not lean your body back, hold your spine with the strength of the stabilizer muscles. \n4. Exhale and lift the barbell over your head, fully extending your elbows. \n5. As you inhale, gently lower the neck to the clavicle part of the chest without dropping the barbell.
1. Stand in front of the mirror, the barbell in lowered outstretched hands with a closed grip from above. The legs are shoulder-width apart and slightly bent at the knees. Shoulder blades are brought together, the back is straight \n2. Stretch the projectile as much as possible upward on exhalation, elbows pointing upwards \n3. At the top point of the movement, stop for one or two seconds, then slowly return to the original position while inhaling
1. Starting position — standing \n2. We take dumbbells and place them in front of us approximately at hip level \n3. Straighten your back, hands with dumbbells should not touch the hips \n4. We lift the arm until it is parallel to the floor (this is approximately the level of your chin) \n5. The distance between the arms when lifting should be equal to the width of your shoulders \n6. When the chin level is reached, it is necessary to stay in this position for 1-2 seconds in order to maximize the use of muscles in work \n7. Gently lower our hands on exhalation and return to the starting position
Tilt barbell press. bench
Dumbbell press on the slope. bench
Dumbbell wiring
Lifting the barbell on the biceps
Exercise “Hammer”
Tight grip press
French bench press
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-10 repetitions)
(2 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
1. Take a position on an inclined bench, adjusting the seat so that the neck is at eye level. \n2. When performing a bench press, the neck should move at the level of the upper line of the pectoral muscles (or above the upper part of the pectoral muscles). The grip in this exercise is identical to the classic grip when pressing on a horizontal bench. The correct grip implies the vertical position of the elbows at the lowest point of the amplitude. \n3.The back should be pressed against the back of the bench.
1. The bench is installed at an angle of 45 degrees \n2. Inhale and exhale, and on exhaling, without a jerk, raise your arm at the elbow \n3. It is not necessary to bend the arm until the dumbbell touches the arm – just as it is not necessary to achieve a straight arm at the end of the movement when extending \n4. Elbows remain motionless during execution – do not bring them back or to the sides
1. To perform the exercise, you need to sit on a bench and put dumbbells on your knees, then take a lying position. With your knees, you need to push the dumbbells to your chest. \n2. The arms should be stretched up in front of the chest, and the dumbbells should touch each other. It is important to keep a small angle at the elbows. \n3. The movement begins with the dilution of dumbbells to the sides on inspiration. It is very important that the elbows look down. The end point of the amplitude is approximately parallel to the floor. \n4. At the lower point of the amplitude, a short pause should be made. \n5. After a pause at the bottom point, return the dumbbells to their original position on exhalation. \n6. The movement is performed only by means of contraction of the pectoral muscles. Perform the exercise in a concentrated manner.
1. Standing, legs shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent (we remove the load from the knees) \n2. Grasp the neck from below, slightly wider than the shoulders \n3. Exhale: bend your arms, lifting the barbell due to biceps efforts \n4. Inhale: gently lower the bar down
1. The athlete must place his feet at shoulder level. The back should be strictly in an upright position. Hands with dumbbells held by a neutral grip are placed on the sides along the hips. Elbow joints are straight. \n2. The movement begins on exhalation. The athlete bends his arms at the elbow joint, straining the shoulder muscles (biceps). Please note that the elbow joints should not move from their place throughout the exercise. \n3. The reverse movement should be performed on the inhale slightly slower than the upward movement.
1. The neck is at eye level, the buttocks and shoulder blades touch the bench, the deflection is performed if it is convenient, and so the body is better stabilized on the bench. \'Bridge\' is not an end in itself in this bench press, as in other bench press movements; \n2. The feet can stand on their toes, or press against the floor, this moment depends on the height of the bench and the length of the athlete\'s legs. The main thing is a stable position of the legs so that they do not move along the \'perimeter\'; \n3. The neck is taken with a closed grip, usually slightly narrower than the shoulders, but this is individual. The triceps also works with an average grip, if you do not \'twist\' your elbows to the sides and do not bend your wrists
1.Lie down on the bench with the angle you have chosen. Take the barbell in your hands (by yourself, or let your partner give it), grip shoulder width apart. The shoulder blades are pressed against the surface on which you are lying, the legs are on the floor. The head is pressed down, lying closer to the edge of the bench. \n2. Lift the barbell up. This is a very important point. If you perform the option to the nose, then keep your hands perpendicular to the floor. \n3. We inhale and bend our arms at the elbow joint, thereby lowering the barbell to the point we have chosen, nose or behind the head. \n4. After fully lowering the barbell, immediately on exhalation, we unbend our arms and return them to their original position. Don\'t make any sudden movements.

Standing toe lifts
(3 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(3 sets of 8-12 repetitions)
(4 sets of 12-20 repetitions)
1. Go to the barbell rack. Take it in such a way that the neck is on the upper part of the sternum and the front parts of the deltas \n2. At the same time, you can cross your arms or put them on the neck with a grip from above \n3. Take a couple of steps away from the counter, put your feet shoulder-width apart \n4. Take a breath and start going down. Continue the movement until the hips are parallel to the floor \n5. Having fixed for a second at the bottom point, return to the starting position.
1. Taking a comfortable fixed position in the simulator, put your feet on the platform \n2. After that, remove the weight clamps with the levers (usually they are located on the sides of the seat) \n3. With the next movement, lower the weight of the platform by bending your legs at the knees \n4. After that, from the lowest point of the amplitude, exhaling, push the platform up with your feet (do not fully straighten your knees)
1. The back should be pressed against the seat \n2. It is impossible to shift and rise from the place during the exercise \n3. For secure fixation and performing concentrated extension, grasp the handles or seat of the simulator \n4. Bending your knees, place your ankles under the roller \n5. Straighten your legs with an exhalation, then fix the position for a second \n6. As you inhale, slowly lower your legs to the starting position
1. We approach the simulator, set the desired weight on it and adjust the height position according to our height \n2. We stand on the platform with the toes of our feet, while the knees should be slightly bent \n3. The shoulders are placed under the soft stops of the simulator \n4. We lower our heels below the platform, thus stretching the calves \n5. On exhalation, we lift the heels, unbending the ankle \n6. We return the heels below the platform \n7. Doing the required number of repetitions
